translated: Points of Controversy
The Minor Collection
The Twenty-second Section
The Discussion of Complete Emancipation

analyzed: atthi kiñci sayojanam a pahāya parinibbānan ti
translated: “Is there any fetter that one has not abandoned in order to attain complete emancipation?”
“Yes.”

original: Atthi kiñci sakkāyadiṭṭhiṁ appahāya …pe… anottappaṁ appahāya parinibbānanti?
analyzed: atthi kiñci sakkāyadiṭṭhim appahāya pe anottappam appahāya parinibbānanti
translated: “Is there any personality view that one has not abandoned … any lack of conscience that one has not abandoned in order to attain complete emancipation?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

analyzed: atthi kiñci sayojanam a pahāya parinibbānan ti
translated: “Is there any fetter that one has not abandoned in order to attain complete emancipation?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: arahā sa rāgaḥ pe sa kilesaḥ iti
translated: “Is a perfected one lustful … is he corrupt?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

analyzed: nanu arahā nirāgaḥ pe nikkilesaḥ ti
translated: “Isn’t a perfected one free from lust … free from corruption?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci arahā nirāgo …pe… nikkileso, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci arahā nirāgaḥ pe nikkilesaḥ no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Yes.”

analyzed: atthi kiñci sayojanam a pahāya parinibbānan ti
translated: “Then it is not tenable that a perfected one has not abandoned any fetter in order to attain complete emancipation.”
“It’s not tenable that

analyzed: atthi kiñci sayojanam a pahāya parinibbānan ti  āmantā
translated: a perfected one has not abandoned any fetter in order to attain complete emancipation.”

analyzed: arahā sabbam buddha visayam jānāti iti
translated: “Does a perfected one know the entire range of the Buddha’s knowledge?”
“Then is it that the Blessed One has not taught the Dhamma?” “One should not say so.”

original: Tena hi atthi kiñci saṁyojanaṁ appahāya parinibbānanti.
analyzed: tena hi atthi kiñci sayojanam a pahāya parinibbānan ti
translated: “Then it must be the case that a perfected one has not abandoned any fetter in order to attain complete emancipation.”
The Discussion of Complete Emancipation is finished.
